content: ❗️ free tutorial for size s + the best price & more always on my website https //loopsonly com/products/double-crochet-crop-raglan-sweater one of the most iconic designs in the world of crochet is the raglan sweater its unique construction characterized by its diagonal seams extending from the neck to the underarms offers a flattering fit for all body types i m thrilled to introduce you to a modern take on this classic design the double_crochet crop raglan sweater **materials** …yarn drops loves you 7 color 28 yarn group a 23 - 26 stitches / 5 ply / sport size xs/s 550 g / 19 5 oz 1870 m / 2050 yds size m/l 650 g / 23 oz 2210 m / 2420 yds size xl/2xl 700 g/ 25 oz 2380 m / 2610 yds …other hook 5 mm/h-8 yarn needle scissors measuring tape stitch markers **gauge** …body and sleeves 14 5 double_crochet = 10 cm width 7 5 row = 10 cm length …ribbing 15 fpdc bpdc = 10 cm width 12 row = 10 cm length **size chart in cm ** xs/s m/l xl/2xl length in cm 36 38 41 waist width in cm 45 49 53 **stitch key us terminology ** chain = chain yo = yarn over st = stitch sts = stitches slip_stitch = slip_stitch sl sts = slip stitches slip_stitch flo = slip_stitch in front loop only double_crochet = double_crochet 2 double_crochet = 2 double_crochet stitches in one stitch fdc = foundation double_crochet double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet = v_stitch decrease = double_crochet two stitches together fpdc = front post double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet space = space **notes** work with 2 strands of yarn foundation chain counts as row 1 it s crocheted from top to bottom you will start working around the neck in joined rounds it s a raglan style sweater one piece no sewing leaving the holes for the sleeves/armholes working on the body and finishing with the sleeves if you prefer a longer sweater simply add additional rounds right after round 2 in the body section ensure you have extra yarn on hand to accommodate the added length to achieve a longer sleeve consider adding additional rounds right after completing round 14/16/18 remember to have sufficient yarn available for the extended length when you are making increases from round 2 to 20 22 24 you work the 1st double_crochet of the increase of the previous round then you work a v_stitch in the chain 1 space and then you skip the 2nd double_crochet of the increase of the previous round and work in the next double_crochet
